channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold prices flirt with near record high but stock futures slide as government shutdown begins
item.description: The U.S. federal government shut down one minute into October, bringing with it uncertainty about jobs and the economy. The shutdown hasn’t brought si...

item.title: Big pharma and Trump announce reduced prices on prescription drugs. Here’s who’s offering discounts
item.description: Several pharmaceutical companies have said they will sell drugs direct to patients in the U.S. and offered discounts following President Donald Trump’...

item.title: Ron DeSantis just took over $66 million worth of prime Miami real estate and gifted it to Trump for a presidential library
item.description: It's the latest demonstration by top Florida Republicans of their loyalty to Trump.

item.title: I Ask Candidates Their Salary Expectations, and I Don’t Feel Bad About It
item.description: Here’s why that’s a bad practice.

item.description: The United States has agreed to allow South Korean workers on short-term visas or a visa waiver program to help build industrial sites in America, Seo...

item.title: Hollywood erupts as talent agents circle ‘AI actor’ Tilly Norwood: ‘Not surprised the first major AI actor is a young woman they can fully control’
item.description: The entertainment industry recently grappled with AI during the four-month SAG-AFTRA strike work stoppage in 2023.

item.title: Your flight’s canceled— now what? Ask the AI travel agent

item.title: A government shutdown is underway. What happens now?
item.description: Washington is bracing for what could be a prolonged federal shutdown after lawmakers deadlocked and missed the deadline for funding the government. Re...

item.title: After 10 Years, McDonald’s Monopoly Game Is Back With an Unexpected Catch—and It’s Brilliant
item.description: Monopoly is back with an update for the app age.

item.title: Red Lobster’s 36-year-old CEO got the company out of bankruptcy. Now he’s plotting the ‘greatest comeback in the history of the restaurant industry’
item.description: “Of course it’s risky,” Damola Adamolekun told Fortune’s Ruth Umoh. “I took over a company that’s bankrupt and had a lot of problems.”

item.title: ‘Default to A.I. or Else,’ Says New Opendoor CEO in a Companywide Email. It’s a Lesson in Emotional Intelligence
item.description: New Opendoor CEO Kas Nejatian recently shared a companywide email. It’s a case study in how not to communicate with your people.

item.title: Climate-conscious Vermont ski resort hires goats to mow its lawn: ‘They’re great employees. They take a lot of lunch breaks, but that’s kind of the idea’
item.description: Herd owner Adam Ricci says he hopes to scale it and build a model to the point where it can be used at other ski resorts.

item.title: Why Spotify Co-Founder Daniel Ek Is Stepping Down as CEO
item.description: The streaming giant’s Chief Business Officer Chief Product and Technology Officer will become co-CEOs.

item.title: Forget retirement: Martha Stewart wants to be a ‘super ager’—she wakes up at 4 a.m., packs in brain games and pilates, before staff arrive at 7 a.m

item.title: How 1 LinkedIn Post Shows the Ruthless Reach of the Starbucks Layoffs

item.title: ADP revision shows loss of jobs in August vs. previously reported gain

Stocks move lower as U.S. government shuts down and private-sector jobs decline
